title: [Demo] Making repository and attach the proposal materials (ECLSS Amateras)
author: siino14

comments.body:
@siino14 When you create a task, please provide:

- User story (simple description of what you do, and a feature/functionality from the perspective of the end-users, and why you need this)
- Acceptance criteria (providing a clear definition of "done." including conditions of satisfaction)

A sentence is enough for both if it is understandable to the team.

**What we do:** Making repository and attach the proposal of demo

**Feature/Functionality from perspective of end-users:** Repository should be added to see new demo

**Why we need this:** To add new demo

**Acceptance criteria:** Making repository and attach the proposal of demo

**What we do:** Teaming to convert current programs of demo 2 to ROS2 version. We would like to gather some members to involve the team.

**Feature/Functionality from perspective of end-users:** ROS2 version is expected in the final version of demo.

**Why we need this:**  ROS2 version of demo is required to integrate the demo.

**Acceptance criteria:** Teaming with 1-3 members at technical meeting, etc.

title: [GitHub] State how to manage ros2 version difference (humble and jazzy)
body:
## User Story:
- Currently SSOS uses ros2 Humble for Ubuntu 22.04, but many users are using ros2 Jazzy with Ubuntu 24.04. This version issue is always an issue depending on circumstances. 

## Acceptance Criteria:
- Decide what to do with SSOS ros2 version and clearly state in the technical meeting.
author: yuyuqq

comments.body: Currently, many of the libraries are only available in Humble (including integration and technologies with Isaac Sim). We will probably take an iterative approach and start in Humble while designing in a way we can account for extensibility/transitioning into Jazzy.

title: [Demo2] Release initial Demo2
body:
(Splitted from space_station_os #15)
## User story
- Frame a repository and scope demo#2 
## Acceptance criteria
- Generate one PPT sheet for the demo, describing cases to demo and assumptions
- Theory including orbit control is appropriate.
author: yuyuqq

comments.body:
I released initial version of demo2 two weeks ago.
Today I updated it. Now not only power generation by SAP but also generation amount optimization has been implemented.
And I updated README.md to describe demo.

Please check README.md.
This was resolved in a recent update from another PR.
